adobe.WebServer

Class ConnectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • adobe.WebServer.ConnectionManager

  • public class ConnectionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This contains the connections to a server object and methods to access/use the connections
    Author:
    rohtalwa

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConnectionManager(Server serverObject)
      Constructs the connection manager privy to a server

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addRequest(java.net.Socket newRequest, int connectionCount)
      Adds a new connection to the list of connections
      void deleteActiveConnections()
      Deletes the list of client sockets having keep alive tag and any other active socket connections
      ClientObj getOneClient() 
      Server getServer()
      Get the server whose connections are being managed
      void serveClients()
      Starts putting work requests by pulling active connections and passes it to worker threads blocks till connections are present in the connection queue
      void setServer(Server server)
      NOTE: Server information is set upon initialization, nevertheless set this only if you want the current connections need to be served by a different server
      void shutDownConnections()
      Shuts down the server completely

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • ConnectionManager

        public ConnectionManager(Server serverObject)
        Constructs the connection manager privy to a server
        Parameters:
        serverObject - the server whose connection manager is to be set

    • Method Detail

      • getServer

        public Server getServer()
        Get the server whose connections are being managed
        Returns:
        Server object that starts this manager

      • setServer

        public void setServer(Server server)
        NOTE: Server information is set upon initialization, nevertheless set this only if you want the current connections need to be served by a different server
        Parameters:
        server - new server that should serve

      • addRequest

        public void addRequest(java.net.Socket newRequest,
                       int connectionCount)
        Adds a new connection to the list of connections
        Parameters:
        newRequest - new/active connection
        connectionCount - - the usage count of this soccket object

      • deleteActiveConnections

        public void deleteActiveConnections()
        Deletes the list of client sockets having keep alive tag and any other active socket connections

      • getOneClient

        public ClientObj getOneClient()
        Returns:
        An instance of a client object that contains an active connection

      • serveClients

        public void serveClients()
        Starts putting work requests by pulling active connections and passes it to worker threads blocks till connections are present in the connection queue

      • shutDownConnections

        public void shutDownConnections()
        Shuts down the server completely
